Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals, including humans, in their natural environments.
The student can label where different plants and animals live (e.g., fish in water, deer in the forest).
The student can illustrate what plants and animals need to survive, such as water, food, and sunlight.
The student can show the relationships between animals/plants and their habitats (e.g., fish need water to live).
The student can represent systems by showing how plants and animals, their habitats, and resources interact to meet their needs.
